subject: Re: [junit] Preventing JUnit from stopping on failures.
msgSnippet: ... You are correct in that you mis-saw .  It was: arrange assert pre-conditions act assert post-conditions The assert pre-conditions was only for the sake
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> I thought I saw this pattern in your example:
>
> arrange
> act
> assert
> act some more
> assert some more
> act some more
> assert some more
>
You are correct in that you "mis-saw". It was:

arrange
assert pre-conditions
act
assert post-conditions

The "assert pre-conditions" was only for the sake of clarity in the
post. This of course would have be done elsewhere (in a construction
test) so that the testApplyCreditMemo() would not have needed to check it.

--
Jason Rogers

"I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I,
but Christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in
the flesh I live by the faith of the Son of God, who loved
me, and gave himself for me."
Galatians 2:20
